Statement
Perry Dozier, a life-long resident of Legislative District 16 and married for 39 years with two grown sons, is committed to creating a better future for our communities.

Perry’s political experience spans 20 years and includes testifying before the United States Senate regarding road, river and rail transportation as well as the United States House Agriculture Committee on farm bill policies.

Perry’s diverse professional experiences and leadership roles, both locally and statewide, bring an in-depth perspective to representing the people of District 16. “As a former County Commissioner responsible for preparing the county budget, I have experienced first-hand how laws from Olympia impact our local communities. I have dealt with an economy in recession. I know how to work with elected officials to reach a favorable outcome.” Perry’s leadership experience, communication skills, and fiscal knowledge will be beneficial in Olympia representing our ideals and way of life in Eastern Washington.

Perry is an advocate for K-12, vocational-tech and higher education. He will work to limit taxes and regulation on businesses which will allow job creation. Perry will promote personal property and water rights including conservation of natural resources. He will work to protect your 2nd amendment rights.
